intro: Sympieza tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered sympieza, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Sympieza tenuiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
